required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of LY3337641 in Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, 2-Part Phase 2 Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of LY3337641 in Adult Subjects With Rheumatoid Arthritis: The RAjuvenate Study

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of LY3337641 in adults with rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with One or More Drug Related Adverse Events (AEs) or any Serious AEs
Proportion of Participants who Achieve American College of Rheumatology 20% Improvement (ACR20) in Part B

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants who Achieve ACR50 and ACR70 in Part B
Change from Baseline in the Disease Activity Score (DAS) 28-high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP) in Part B
Proportion of Participants who Achieve Low Disease Activity Using DAS28-hsCRP in Part B
Proportion of Participants who Achieve Clinical Remission Using DAS28-hsCRP in Part B

arm_group.description: Given once a day for 4 weeks.
Given once a day for 4 weeks.
Given once a day for 4 weeks.
Given once a day for 4 weeks.
Given once a day for 12 weeks.
Given once a day for 12 weeks.
Given once a day for 12 weeks.
Given once a day for 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female subjects test negative for pregnancy at screening and agree not to breastfeed
- Female subjects: agree to use a reliable method of birth control from the start of screening until 2 weeks after the last dose of study drug or be of nonchildbearing potential
- Male subjects: agree to use a reliable method of birth control from the start of screening until 2 weeks after the last dose of study drug or have undergone vasectomy
- Have a diagnosis of RA based on the 2010 ACR/European League against Rheumatism criteria
- Have at least 1 of the following:
- rheumatoid factor or anti-citrullinated peptide antibodies (ACPA) at screening OR
- radiographs documenting bony erosions
- Have active RA, defined as:
- Part A: ≥3 swollen joints (based on 66-joint counts)
- Part B:
- ≥6 swollen joints (based on 66-joint counts)
- ≥6 tender joints (based on 68-joint counts)
- hsCRP levels greater than the upper limit of normal (ULN) OR positive for ACPA
- Part B only: Have had inadequate response, loss of response, or intolerance to at least 1 synthetic OR biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received any of the following:
- Part B only: any prior treatment with a product directly targeting Bruton's tyrosine kinase (BTK) (marketed or investigational)
- belimumab, natalizumab, or vedolizumab within 6 months prior to baseline
- B-cell-depleting agents (such as rituximab) or other cell-depleting biologics (eg, anti-CD3 antibody) within 12 months prior to screening for Part A or at any time prior to screening for Part B
- Have known hypogammaglobulinemia
- Have hepatitis C virus, hepatitis B virus or human immunodeficiency virus
- Have active tuberculosis (TB)
- Are at high risk of infection or have recent evidence of clinically significant infection
- Have had lymphoma, leukemia, or any malignancy within the previous 5 years except for treated basal cell or squamous epithelial carcinomas of the skin
- Have received a live (attenuated) vaccine within 28 days prior to baseline or plan to receive one during the study

link.description: Click here for more information about this study: A Study of LY3337641 in Participants With Rheumatoid Arthritis (RAjuvenate)

patient_data.ipd_description: Lilly provides access to the individual patient data from studies on approved medicines and indications as defined by the sponsor specific information on ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. This access is provided in a timely fashion after the primary publication is accepted. Researchers need to have an approved research proposal submitted through ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. Access to the data will be provided in a secure data sharing environment after signing a data sharing agreement.
